member.name: M:Peachpie.Library.Network.CURLFunctions.curl_version(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets cURL version information.
member.param: Ignored. Should be set to the version of this functionality by the time you write your program. This way, libcurl will always return a proper struct that your program understands, while programs in the future might get a different struct. CURLVERSION_NOW will be the most recent one for the library you have installed.

member.name: M:Peachpie.Library.Network.CURLFunctions.curl_multi_remove_handle(Peachpie.Library.Network.CURLMultiResource,Peachpie.Library.Network.CURLResource)
member.summary: Remove a multi handle from a set of cURL handles
member.remarks: Removes a given handle from the given handle. When the handle has been removed, it is again perfectly legal to run on this handle. Removing the handle while being used, will effectively halt the transfer in progress involving that handle.

member.name: M:Peachpie.Library.Network.CURLFunctions.curl_multi_exec(Pchp.Core.Context,Peachpie.Library.Network.CURLMultiResource,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Run the sub-connections of the current cURL handle.

member.summary: CURLINFO_HEADER_OUT option.

member.name: P:Peachpie.Library.Network.CURLResource.Timeout
member.summary: The maximum number of miliseconds to allow cURL functions to execute.

member.name: P:Peachpie.Library.Network.CURLResource.ContinueTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets a timeout, in milliseconds, to wait until the 100-Continue is received from the server.

member.name: P:Peachpie.Library.Network.CURLResource.BufferSize
member.summary: If set, specifies the size of internal buffer used for read when passing response content to user's function.

member.name: P:Peachpie.Library.Network.CURLResource.UserAgent
member.summary: The contents of the "User-Agent: " header to be used in a HTTP request.

member.name: P:Peachpie.Library.Network.CURLResource.AcceptEncoding
member.summary: The contents of the Accept-Encoding header.

member.name: P:Peachpie.Library.Network.CURLResource.ProtocolVersion
member.summary: If set, specifies the HTTP protocol version to be used for the request.

member.name: P:Peachpie.Library.Network.CURLResource.PostFields
member.summary: The full data to post in a HTTP "POST" operation. This parameter can either be passed as a urlencoded string like 'para1=val1&para2=val2&...' or as an array with the field name as key and field data as value. If value is an array, the Content-Type header will be set to multipart/form-data.

member.name: P:Peachpie.Library.Network.CURLResource.Headers
member.summary: Headers to be send with the request. Keys of the array are ignored, values are in form of header-name: value

member.name: P:Peachpie.Library.Network.CURLResource.CookieHeader
member.summary: The value of the Cookie header. Ignored if already present in .

member.name: P:Peachpie.Library.Network.CURLResource.CookieFileSet
member.summary: As long as is set (regardless of the value, even null suffices), the cookies retrieved from the server are recorded.

member.name: F:Peachpie.Library.Network.CURLResource.ProcessingHeaders
member.summary: Specify how to process headers. WARN: if is RETURN => STDOUT means RETURN.

member.name: F:Peachpie.Library.Network.CURLResource.ProcessingResponse
member.summary: Specify how to process content.

member.name: F:Peachpie.Library.Network.CURLResource.ProcessingRequest
member.summary: Specify how to process request stream.

member.summary: Private data set to the handle.

member.name: P:Peachpie.Library.Network.CURLResource.Protocols
member.summary: Bit mask of enabled protocols. All by default.

member.name: P:Peachpie.Library.Network.CURLResource.RequestHeaders
member.summary: Optional. Request headers sent including the leading line (GET / HTTP) and trailing newline (\n\n).

member.name: P:Peachpie.Library.Network.CURLResource.ResponseTask
member.summary: Ongoing request handled by the framework. Must be set to null after being processed.

member.name: P:Peachpie.Library.Network.CURLResource.Result
member.summary: Response after the execution.
